storyInfo: Fischer suppresses everyone and begins to interrogate Reed. Harmonie knows she will expose her identity as a double agent, yet she has no choice but to launch a rescue.

attributes.content: No, run! They're over here, too!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Bloody hell... They've got this whole open part surrounded, don't they?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Erk...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Freeze.
attributes.name: Special Forces Soldier

attributes.content: Okay, okay, I—I will... Bit too close with your saber there... You won't slip or anything, right?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: R-Reed, help us! What do we do?!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Against this many... it'll be hard to force our way out.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Huff... huh...? Did they just break my cudgel in half?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee
Reed
attributes.content: ...They're acting very confident—

attributes.name: Reed
attributes.content: They don't want to seize us violently. They just want to quell the resistance we put up.
attributes.joined: ...They're acting very confident—They don't want to seize us violently. They just want to quell the resistance we put up.

attributes.content: Oof, not half bad, this lot...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I don't get it. How'd they follow us out to here? Where'd they come from...?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: —Wait, that one. I've seen him before.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: A couple days ago, when we ran into the spectre force...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Which means you lot aren't County Trent. These refugees are outside your jurisdiction. You've got no authority to arrest them.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We'll have to take off our gloves here, if you're not goin' to follow the rules.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: The rules? That goes for you too. I see your piledriver spear missing its shells. You shouldn't be in a mile of the battlefield, soldier.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: It's not like this was meant to be a battlefield, was it?! They've not even put the campfire out...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: —Watch out!
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: A black dagger slides forward without a sound. Its tip reflects not even the slightest bit of light, instead drawing a path of smoke.
The dagger points intimidatingly at Bagpipe's throat, though its bearer gives it no glance; his eyes have been focused squarely on Reed.
Reed can tell clearly, from his sharp glare, that he and the army are out for her here.
Isn't your pike meant to be burning with flames?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I suggest you drop the futile resistance. Make the smart choice, lay your weapons down, and hear me out.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I have nothing against the Tarans, let alone any plans to retaliate against civilians. And as for steering the masses clear of ruin, you and I should be united on that front.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Here's the official paperwork.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: What? A City Council writ of investigation?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: The former Victorian soldier sets her weapon down.
Per the Council of the County of Trent's decision, I am here to investigate an overlooked, puzzling aspect of the arson cases.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...I—have no other choice, correct?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: *sniffle*... *sob*...
attributes.name: Young Taran Refugee

attributes.content: —What are you doing? Quiet down.
attributes.name: Soldier on Guard

attributes.content: (Agh, this is terrible.)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (Always thought I should at least get my will in order, you know, before I finally meet my maker...)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (If you ask me? Should've written it up long ago.)
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: (I did right after we first made it out, but I tore it up, I've been so happy these past two days. Really regret that now.)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (Oh, shut up, Fionn. We're not done for yet.)
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: (They've got us all tied up and gagged, and everything we had to fight with got taken away. What else are we gonna do other than wait to die?)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (Sigh... Interrogation. Terrifying word. How many Tarans do we know made it alive out of an interrogation?)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (And who knows what they're prying out of a woman as kind as Reed.)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (We all know each other, like family we are, but we don't know Reed from a bar of soap. Don't know where she came from, don't know what she was doing before.)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (What, is she an enemy to you now?!)
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: (No, no, no, that's not what I meant... I just...)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (*sigh* Selmon. You can't just make someone not be afraid to die.)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (We can still see the fire from here. How long's it been since we last had the light of fire on a cold dark night?)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (Really thought I managed to escape, I did.)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (You even came about borrowing some stuff to rustle up some money. Didn't I say I'd make you some smoked fowl to sell?)
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: (Enough. We need to think of something. Figure this situation out.)
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: (What? Figure this out? And what good is it gonna do us?)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (...I'm fed up of this, that's all.)
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: (I hate listening to how much you just sigh. Squatting about in the Taran quarter, passing by village threshing floors... it's just sighs everywhere. I'm sick of it.)
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: (Enough. Save it. Don't ask me how. You've always managed to find a way out.)
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: (I'll draw the attention of those guards. Whatever you're going to do, figure it out yourself.)
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: You can ease yourself a little, 'Reed.' We're just having an ordinary chat.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: We have a warm fire, and we can hear the fowls chirp in the night. Surely you'd agree, this is a much more comfortable environment for conversation than a full-fledged interrogation room would be.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: No comment? That's your choice. I won't give you trouble for it.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Perhaps the nearby barracks' disrespect has given you cause for alarm. Allow me to apologize in their stead.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Are you... here to investigate Dublinn? None of the people here have anything to do with them...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You needn't explain. As you'd expect, I already have a good grasp of the situation.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: A singular attack has indeed spurred a minor region's barracks to take undue action against approximately a dozen Tarans, going so far as to accuse them of being part of 'Dublinn insurrectionist forces'.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: But in the company of all else contained in this very, very heavy dossier, their mistakes aren't worthy of mention. Of course, your situation is a little different compared to anyone else's...
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...But I believe I can do something to help you break free of these troubles.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: After all, no stretch of your escape can have been easy.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: If... it wasn't for such harsh decrees, they would never have needed to run.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No, please. This is a chat between the two of us, and I'm hoping you'll tell me about yourself. About the escape you began long prior to this one.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...I don't understand what you're talking about.
attributes.name: Reed
Fischer
attributes.content: I'm asking you—

attributes.name: Fischer
attributes.content: About your past identity.
There are no records of any kind on you. No medical records, no nomadic city immigration records, no tax records, nothing.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...We Tarans are driven out wherever we go. It's not strange—that you don't see me in Victoria's records.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Then what about the unrest in County Hillock last autumn? Were you there?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: And what about the County Peninsula attack last May?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I'm asking you and you alone.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Madam, if one does not tell anyone their birth name, where they are from, or who they are...
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Wouldn't you say... they're just like a 'shadow?'
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Chenchen, I reckon you've already figured out who these men are?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Yeah. The ones that just fought us are no normal soldiers. Interrogating on the spot is very unique for procedure, too.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Plus, their leader knows quite a lot. That's why he's so courteous toward us... and me in particular.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Right. I was just thinkin', they're lettin' us stand here and wait, only keepin' a couple men on watch, but the Tarans all have to have their hands bound. It's not fair...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Still, how'd he figure out who you are?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...I didn't expect the Intelligence Service to work this case.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: The Intelligence Service? Why would THEY be lookin' for Reed?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Her background must be an unusual one.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: And that's why she insisted on acting alone. She didn't want to drag anyone into the mess.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Oh, I've got a bad feelin' about this... Are they actually goin' to talk, you know, to a Taran? They won't rough her up, or threaten her into sayin' somethin' against her will, right?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Keep your voice down.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Mm... I remember what you wrote in your report on County Hillock.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Right. He's got his writ from City Council, he says he'll keep the peace and he has nothin' against Tarans, but...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: No. I should trust more. He's still an arm of City Council. He's not here to mess things up.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Most people can't withstand the pressure of interrogations, though.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: ...Do you remember how we did things, back in school when we partnered up?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Oh! Your hand signal. I do...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I remember. That's the ones we communicated with, the time we snatched those hazardous Originium products.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Good thing you remember.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: It doesn't matter what Reed's background is. If she ends up as someone's pawn, that's going to send ripples through the status quo.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Yeah, and it'll be a nightmare on her as well... I mean, she's always seemed like she's been—tryin' to shake herself of somethin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I hear you loud and clear, Chenchen. We'll bring her back to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Dearie, me... what pristinely clear tracks.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: It seems your opponent is extending you an invitation again.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Oh, please, less ridicule.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: And unfortunately, I'm afraid 'invitation' is an overstatement this time. He doesn't even so much as care about what dance his guest intends on.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: We're making our positions plenty clear just by showing our faces.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Dublinn will rescue poor Loughshinny, expose her identity... and in the end, testify as to where I really stand.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: And he knows. I have to wade in... so the other Draco of Tara doesn't land in his Duke's hands, and lessen The Leader's influence as a Draco herself.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: No matter. I shall wipe his ambitions clean.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: ...The fowlbeasts have stopped calling. Do you understand what that means?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...... (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: That's fine. Why don't we start with accounts of your recent incidents?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: You haven't caused serious injury to anyone. Even the arson at the barracks resulted in no deaths nor casualties, with only some supplies lost to fire.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Most Tarans are driven by their hatred of the Victorians to commit graver crimes. Your methods, in contrast, have been very mild.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Some witnesses even attest how you tried to fend off the Dublinn soldiers.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Do you admit to all this?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I can only admit—I by no means wish to harm others.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Good. I can believe that. You have a fair conscience in you.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Now, if we can turn our attention to the quietened fowlbeasts...
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: ...It seems your Dublinn friends are here to save you.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: No... No.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I can't go back...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Go back? Oh, you mean—back to your life as a shadow?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Back to the kind of life surrounded by smoldering corpses, where the ashes of the dead coat the city streets?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: To someone blessed with a conscience, it must be a very painful life.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: But it so happens you have a chance right now. You can make your own decision.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Accept our protection. Your past crimes will be looked into no further.
attributes.name: Fischer
Reed
attributes.content: I will never!
attributes.joined: I'm asking you—About your past identity.I...I will never!

attributes.text: She must run. Run from the watchful eyes of all.
But how far must she go before she's finally run away?

attributes.content: Now!
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Aye!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Sorry, but you'll want to try on my fortcracker for size again!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Brandishing her piledriver spear, Bagpipe's gaze is away from the tent. Behind her stands Ch'en, and Ch'en's eyes, however, widen for an instant.
With not a sound, the tent over the interrogation turns to ashes.
A beam of flames bolts through the dark night, to then immediately vanish without a trace.
